liquivelte.enable-ts-plugin.title: Enable TypeScript Liquivelte plugin
liquivelte.enable-ts-plugin.description: Enables a TypeScript plugin which provides intellisense for Liquivelte files inside TS/JS files.

liquivelte.ask-to-enable-ts-plugin.title: Ask to enable TypeScript Liquivelte plugin
liquivelte.ask-to-enable-ts-plugin.description: Ask on startup to enable the TypeScript plugin.

liquivelte.language-server.runtime.title: Language Server Runtime
liquivelte.language-server.runtime.description: - You normally don't need this - Path to the node executable to use to spawn the language server. This is useful when you depend on native modules such as node-sass as without this they will run in the context of vscode, meaning node version mismatch is likely. Minimum required node version is 12.17. This setting can only be changed in user settings for security reasons.

liquivelte.language-server.ls-path.title: Language Server Path
liquivelte.language-server.ls-path.description: - You normally don't set this - Path to the language server executable. If you installed the "svelte-language-server" npm package, it's within there at "bin/server.js". Path can be either relative to your workspace root or absolute. Set this only if you want to use a custom version of the language server. This will then also use the workspace version of TypeScript. This setting can only be changed in user settings for security reasons.

liquivelte.language-server.port.title: Language Server Port
liquivelte.language-server.port.description: - You normally don't set this - At which port to spawn the language server. Can be used for attaching to the process for debugging / profiling. If you experience crashes due to "port already in use", try setting the port. -1 = default port is used.

liquivelte.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VS Code and the Liquivelte Language Server.

liquivelte.plugin.typescript.definitions.title: TypeScript: Go to Definition
liquivelte.plugin.typescript.definitions.description: Enable go to definition for TypeScript

liquivelte.plugin.typescript.signatureHe.title: TypeScript: Signature Help
liquivelte.plugin.typescript.signatureHe.description: Enable signature help (parameter hints) for TypeScript

liquivelte.plugin.typescript.rename.enab.title: TypeScript: Rename
liquivelte.plugin.typescript.rename.enab.description: Enable rename functionality for JS/TS variables inside Liquivelte files

liquivelte.plugin.typescript.semanticTok.title: TypeScript: Semantic Tokens
liquivelte.plugin.typescript.semanticTok.description: Enable semantic tokens (semantic highlight) for TypeScript.

liquivelte.plugin.typescript.implementat.title: Typescript: Go to Implementation
liquivelte.plugin.typescript.implementat.description: Enable go to implementation for Typescript

liquivelte.plugin.css.globals.title: CSS: Global Files
liquivelte.plugin.css.globals.description: Which css files should be checked for global variables (`--global-var: value;`). These variables are added to the css completions. String of comma-separated file paths or globs relative to workspace root.

liquivelte.plugin.css.completions.emmet.title: CSS: Include Emmet Completions
liquivelte.plugin.css.completions.emmet.description: Enable emmet auto completions for CSS

liquivelte.plugin.html.completions.emmet.title: HTML: Include Emmet Completions
liquivelte.plugin.html.completions.emmet.description: Enable emmet auto completions for HTML

liquivelte.plugin.html.renameTags.enable.title: HTML: Rename tags
liquivelte.plugin.html.renameTags.enable.description: Enable rename for the opening/closing tag pairs in HTML

liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.compilerWar.title: Liquivelte: Compiler Warnings Settings
liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.compilerWar.description: Liquivelte compiler warning codes to ignore or to treat as errors. Example: { 'css-unused-selector': 'ignore', 'unused-export-let': 'error'}

liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.format.enab.title: Liquivelte: Format
liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.format.enab.description: Enable formatting for Liquivelte (includes css & js). You can set some formatting options through this extension. They will be ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.format.conf.title: Liquivelte Format: Sort Order
liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.format.conf.description: Format: join the keys `options`, `scripts`, `markup`, `styles` with a - in the order you want. This option is ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.format.conf.title: Liquivelte Format: Strict Mode
liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.format.conf.description: More strict HTML syntax. This option is ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.format.conf.title: Liquivelte Format: Allow Shorthand
liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.format.conf.description: Option to enable/disable component attribute shorthand if attribute name and expression are the same. This option is ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.format.conf.title: Liquivelte Format: Bracket New Line
liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.format.conf.description: Put the `>` of a multiline element on a new line. This option is ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.format.conf.title: Liquivelte Format: Indent Script And Style
liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.format.conf.description: Whether or not to indent code inside `<script>` and `<style>` tags. This option is ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.format.conf.title: Liquivelte Format: Print Width
liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.format.conf.description: Maximum line width after which code is tried to be broken up. This is a Prettier core option. If you have the Prettier extension installed, this option is ignored and the corresponding option of that extension is used instead. This option is also ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.format.conf.title: Liquivelte Format: Quotes
liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.format.conf.description: Use single quotes instead of double quotes, where possible. This is a Prettier core option. If you have the Prettier extension installed, this option is ignored and the corresponding option of that extension is used instead. This option is also ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.defaultScri.title: Liquivelte: Default Script Language
liquivelte.plugin.liquivelte.defaultScri.description: The default language to use when generating new script tags

scripts.build:grammar: npx js-yaml syntaxes/liquivelte.tmLanguage.src.yaml > syntaxes/liquivelte.tmLanguage.json && npx js-yaml syntaxes/postcss.src.yaml > syntaxes/postcss.json
scripts.build: npm run build:ts && npm run build:grammar
scripts.pretest: npm run test-compile && npm run lint
